item.title: Bramble, leaves, 15th December
item.description:
This pavement, as you exit Butt's wood, tge road that enters into galliins reach health center, the brambles from the church are overgrown onto pavement, plus a build up of old leaves. As you walk on pavement, which is narrow, the brambles are catching our legs, scratching, make bleed, and our voats and trousers get pulled, making small tares!! It also has caught on my dogs face ! It can do injury, can it bloody hurts. Do we then need ask compensation for ruined clothing, or for vetenary work for our pet!! Please can it be cut back, im moaned about it before.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bentham Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green bikes, 15th December
item.description:
Obe bike in water, been there 6mths or more, there's another in grass area at side if water, plus metal railing left by work men after tarmacking. The water could really do eith the rubbish removing, not good for the wildlife, ducks, swans that visit here. Glasses and plastic bottles, wood, the bike, tin foil, you name it it's there. At the side, an area you can sit if full of weeds, broken tree branches, ir looks like a tip so people use it as one, im daily picking up beer cans and empty bottles from this area, so that students don't throw in water at the birds. Maybe if clean, people may not leave the crap there !!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hutchins Road, Thamesmead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
